text:
BREAKING: Bridge collapses on I-85 during massive fire breaking news View Caption Hide Caption A bridge on I-85 northbound just south of Ga. 400 has collapsed. (Credit: Channel 2 Action News) Story Highlights A massive fire was reported on I-85 about 6:30 p.m. A bridge collapsed about 7 p.m. Fire officials extinguished a massive fire on I-85 on Thursday night after it burned for more than an hour and led to the collapse of a bridge on the interstate, fire officials said. #REDALERT I-85 shutdown both ways between GA-400 and I-75. Piedmont & Buford Spring Conn blocked. I-285 & I-20 best interstate alternates pic.twitter.com/fQxItzdDhE — AJC WSB Traffic (@ajcwsbtraffic) March 30, 2017 The bridge on I-85 northbound just south of Ga. 400 near Piedmont Road collapsed about 7 p.m. Thursday, Atlanta fire spokesman Sgt. Cortez Stafford said. A bridge on I-85 northbound just south of Ga. 400 collapsed about 7 p.m. Thursday. “We do have the fire under control,” Stafford said. No injuries to motorists or first responders were reported. All lanes on the interstate remain blocked. Earlier, heavy black smoke could be seen for miles. Officials turned cars around on the interstate just before 8 p.m. JUST IN: A viewer sent us this photo of the fire as it started underneath I-85. It has now caused part of the road to collapse. Live on CH 2 pic.twitter.com/7VjGyAfedR 
PHOTOS: I-85 shut down by fire, heavy smoke 
Spokeswoman Natalie Dale said the department does not know what caused the fire. But she said its HERO units are directing people away from the area, and GDOT bridge inspectors are on the way. All lanes on I-85 are closed due to heavy black smoke from a massive fire. (Credit: Channel 2 Action News) 
“We’re still trying to figure out what’s going on,” Dale said. “But if people are on I-85, they need to exit.” 
Dale said the interstate will be closed in both directions “for the foreseeable future.” #REDALERT I-85 blocked both ways just s of GA-400 b/c massive vehicle fire on Piedmont bridge under I-85 #ATLtraffic @wsbradio @wsbtv pic.twitter.com/RWMIXEGALm — Fireball Turnbull (@DougTurnbull) March 30, 2017 Google Earth images show PVC piping that was under the I-85 bridge along Piedmont Road where a fire broke out Thursday night. (Credit: Google Earth) The flames appear to be coming from underneath the interstate. 
Fire officials are asking drivers in the area to keep their windows closed. 
A resident of the Peninsula at Buckhead, Paula Pontes, said when her home went dark she thought it was an incoming storm. 
“It got dark all of a sudden so I turned on the news to see if it was the rain,” Pontes told The Atlanta Journal-Constitution. 
She said she never heard an explosion and couldn’t see flames, but it smelled like burnt rubber. 
“I didn’t panic because I couldn’t see the fire coming,” she said. “It was just smoke. It became night.” 
— Staff writer David Wickert contributed to this article.
